alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula; Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 26 at 11:55PM AKST until December 27 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. * WHERE...Lower Kobuk Valley, Baldwin Peninsula and Northern Seward Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold temperatures are occuring over Northwest Alaska. Winds are expected to increase around Kotzebue Sound tonight and cause very cold winds chills to develop. Temperatures are expected to rise on Wednesday morning as clouds move over the area and wind chills will become less severe then.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula
